clinical_study.brief_title: The Blood Glucose Control in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Treated With Glargine
clinical_study.official_title: The Current Situation and Influence Factors of Blood Glucose Control in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Treated With Glargine in China

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanjing First Hospital, Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: Nanjing First Hospital, Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Glargine is commonly used in insulin supplemental therapy in patients with type 2 diabetes(T2D) at present. This study aims to investigate the current status of blood glucose control in patients with T2D treated with glargine. Glycated hemoglobin(HbA1c) will be tested in these patients to assess the blood glucose control and Continuous Glucose Monitoring System (CGMS) will be used to investigate the glucose variability. Islet function, duration of diabetes, complications, exercise, insulin dose, oral medication regimen and insulin antibodies will be recorded in detail. This study will analysis the association between these clinical characteristics and blood glucose control.

primary_outcome.description: 24 h mean amplitude of glycemic excursions
the standard deviation of the MBG

intervention.description: Continuous Glucose Monitoring System for 72 hours

study_pop.textblock: Chinese outpatients with type 2 diabetes in Nanjing First Hospital who meet the the eligibility criteria.
